Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Scolopendin 1 (natural AMPs; myriapods, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: Chinese red-headed centipedeScolopendra subspinipes mutilans, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Identified from adult centipedes using RNA sequencing. The peptude is C-terminally amidated.Activity: Active against G+ bacteria S. aureus ATCC 25923, E. faecium ATCC 19434 (MIC 5-10 uM), G- bacteria E. coli O-157 ATCC 43895, P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 5 uM), and fungi C. albicans ATCC 90028, C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019, and T. beigelii KCTC 7707 (MIC 10-20 uM). MOA: scolopendin 1 induced ROS accumulation in Candida albicans. Provided by Kyle Lau. Reg 12/10/2014.
Literature Information.Author: Choi H, Hwang JS, Lee DG.2014
Literature Information.Title: Identification of a novel antimicrobial peptide, scolopendin 1, derived from centipede Scolopendra subspinipes mutilans and its antifungal mechanism.
